attributes.comment:
As a lawyer who works at a non-profit agency representing immigrants in the
process of legalizing their status through the already costly system that currently
exists, I was appalled to see the extremity of the proposed fee increase. To
increase the adjustment of status application from around $300 to over $900 is
unfair. This is about family reunification and to force US citizens and permanent
residents to pay such high fees to do what's right and what's legal (i.e. legalize
their status) is insulting and degrading. I see how hardworking the immigrants in
my community are and I think their money would be better spent on their family's
well-being and society as a whole rather than on fees. If the family unit is
supposedly the underlying backbone of this country, this drastic fee increase will
only undermine that and have devastating effects in many respects. I urge you to
reconsider this method of "enhancing service" and not raise the fees in such an
insulting way.

Sincerely,
Melissa Ewer
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Melissa M. Ewer
